sourcing.instructions: B: Obtain from a chemical supply store or online vendor (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich). Cr: Purchase from a metallurgical supplier or online (e.g., Amazon). Nb: Available from specialty metal vendors or online suppliers. Ru: Sourced from precious metal suppliers or chemical vendors.
steps: B: Obtain from a chemical supply store or online vendor (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich). Cr: Purchase from a metallurgical supplier or online (e.g., Amazon). Nb: Available from specialty metal vendors or online suppliers. Ru: Sourced from precious metal suppliers or chemical vendors.

1. Weigh out 6.0 g of Boron (B) using a precise balance. 2. Weigh 3.0 g of Chromium (Cr). 3. Weigh 3.0 g of Niobium (Nb). 4. Weigh 6.0 g of Ruthenium (Ru). 5. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic or glass container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle or a ball mill to thoroughly mix the powders until homogeneous.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 6.0 g of Boron (B) using a precise balance. 2. Weigh 3.0 g of Chromium (Cr). 3. Weigh 3.0 g of Niobium (Nb). 4. Weigh 6.0 g of Ruthenium (Ru). 5. Combine all ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic or glass container. 6. Use a mortar and pestle or a ball mill to thoroughly mix the powders until homogeneous.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder to a graphite crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 3. Heat to 1300°C (2372°F) at a rate of 10°C per minute. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to facilitate alloying.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder to a graphite crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 3. Heat to 1300°C (2372°F) at a rate of 10°C per minute. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to facilitate alloying.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled to below 200°C (392°F) to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled to below 200°C (392°F) to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified sample. 3. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper (1000 grit) for a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, apply a protective sealant or coating if the material will be exposed to the environment.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solidified sample. 3. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper (1000 grit) for a smooth finish. 5. Optionally, apply a protective sealant or coating if the material will be exposed to the environment.
